context_text: <A> [ mhm yeah this ] was this was the most media war that we've ever had i think uh and uh i during the first war over there the media was kinda kept at a distance and people weren't really aware of what was going on but the pentagon seem to have a a greater hold on on the information this time they let the media go in but the media for the most part was you know a like a rallying point you know for { the } / <B> [ mhm ] / <A> war like a cheerleading squad more or less and and of course { you } / <B> [ yeah ] / <A> had a couple of um you had a couple of newsmen who made comments that offended a lot of people and one was fired and let me see uh that peter arnett i think i think that was one who worked for cnn or one of those cable channels / <B> yeah / <A> and that well he maybe did step over the line a little bit because he i think he made some statements that weren't totally true you know and he said things were going bad and it was a total disaster and it's true things got bogged down for a few days but you know i mean i think he portrayed like it was just you know a whole mess and a total disaster which it it wasn't i think i think he had a he was expressing his opinion more or less i don't think it was based on on fact you know { so i } / <B> [ mhm ]
